content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Lab (Research Facility) at Position (0.5, 2.5)
Intended to supply Automation Science Packs for research, this structure was targeted repeatedly but never successfully placed due to inventory shortages and crafting prerequisite failures.

### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
Used for smelting iron ore and coal into additional iron plates. The agent retrieved and utilized this furnace during resource processing operations.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (–27.0, –60.0)
Deployed for processing copper ore and coal into copper plates, this furnace was similarly engaged to resolve a resource shortage for lab crafting components.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Argument Errors – Ensure that retrieval calls like get_entities match the function’s signature. Remove unexpected keyword arguments (e.g., “radius”) and adjust positional arguments as required.

• None Handling in Entity Retrieval – Before iterating over results, verify that a valid list is returned; use an empty list as a fallback if the function returns None.

• Crafting Prerequisite Shortages – Prior to lab crafting, confirm the complete availability of all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-plate, iron-gear-wheel, copper-plate, copper-cable, and electronic-circuit) and ensure that preceding production processes (like furnace smelting) are properly established.

• Lab Placement Reliability – Validate that inventory holds the necessary Lab item and that resource chains are fully satisfied before attempting placement, to avoid repeated failures.
